definition: hurray!/hurrah!/yippee!
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
Wow!/sound of child's crying/sound of vomiting
replaces 啊[a5] when following the vowel "u" or "ao"

sentences.english: When will the mountain over there nice to play a game of wow.
sentences.chinese: 什么时候能到山那边去玩一玩该多好哇。

sentences.english: Yes, I can have a break from all this tired work in the office.
sentences.chinese: 好哇，这样我就可以暂时忘却累人的工作了。

sentences.english: "They've been at work, here, all right, " said one of the policemen.
sentences.chinese: “好哇，他们在这里捣过鬼，”一个警察说。

sentences.english: OK. Let's go to Switzerland then.
sentences.chinese: 好哇，那么我们去瑞士度假吧。

sentences.english: Hey, that sounds a good idea.

definition: (interjection of surprise, pain, annoyance etc)/Oh my!/Uh-oh!/Ah!/Ouch!
see 哇塞[wa1 sai1]
(onom.) expressing admiration or surprise/sound of a laugh
phonetic a, similar to 呵/-azine, see 吖嗪[a1 qin2]
sentence-final particle similar to 了[le5], but carrying a tone of approval
used in transliteration
hey/ow/ouch/interjection of pain or surprise
interjection of surprise/Oh my!
to draw back the corners of one's mouth
modal particle expressing exclamation
see 咧咧[lie1 lie1]
You're really quite something!/You're just amazing!
excellent (interjection)
sigh/exclamation Eh!
(slang) alternative for 哎呦[ai1 you1] "oh my!"
the bleating of sheep/final particle which transforms statements into questions that indicate doubt or surprise (Cantonese)
old variant of 咩[mie1]
hey
super!/really great/wonderful
